title: Glastonbury fence-jumpers: 'It was girls underneath, boys over the top!'
description: There was a golden age of breaking into Glastonbury. It's now over but some still manage it.

title: Jon Stewart: 'There will always be room for political satire'
description: The former host of The Daily Show has written and directed a new political comedy film.

title: Rethink: Caleb Femi says 'creative thinking' is key to students' future
description: Poet Caleb Femi says the young must be innovative to progress, in one of a series of essays for the BBC.

title: Coronavirus: Cut negatives capture the isolation of lockdown
description: Photographer Aletheia Casey talks about her series To Dance With Shadows, made during the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: Women denied abortions because of the pandemic
description: Women across Europe are struggling to get abortions because of the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: Looking for viruses in Thai bats
description: Thai scientists are collecting bats to find clues about the origins of viruses, including Covid-19.

title: Belly Mujinga: Protesters 'defending my wife's cause' says husband
description: Belly Mujinga's husband says the Black Lives Matter protesters are helping to keep her case going.

title: Coronavirus: 'We went from 30 customers to one in 18 hours'
description: Cleaners saw most bookings cancelled in the first months of lockdown, and the future looks uncertain.

title: 'It was a shock' - the shops not allowed to reopen
description: Beauticians, gyms and tattoo artists have been let frustrated by the news they must remain closed.

title: How coming-of-age rituals have been reinvented during coronavirus
description: How coming-of-age rituals were interrupted - and reinvented - amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: How will cinemas reopen in England, and what can you see?
description: Cinemas in England can reopen from 4 July, but many will not be ready to do so by that date.

title: Burnley banner: 'You do not speak for us, our club or our town'
description: The people of Burnley blast the "White Lives Matter" banner flown over Manchester City's ground.

title: Hairdresser: 'We've built a waiting list of over 2,000 people'
description: Hairdressers can reopen from 4 July - and customers are clearly desperate for a cut.

title: Novak Djokovic: World number one becomes latest tennis player to test positive for coronavirus
description: World number one Novak Djokovic becomes the latest tennis player to test positive for Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown relaxed in England as 2m rule eased
description: Pubs, restaurants, hotels and hairdressers can open from 4 July in England, when social distancing rules will be eased.

title: Grand National-winning jockey Treadwell dies, aged 34
description: Jockey Liam Treadwell, who rode 100-1 shot Mon Mome to victory in the 2009 Grand National, dies aged 34.

title: Reading stabbings: Victims were 'true gentlemen'
description: Tributes are paid to three men who died, as police question a suspect arrested under the Terrorism Act.

title: Blackpool Airport suspends banner flights
description: Blackpool Airport suspends banner flights from its base after the message 'White Lives Matter Burnley' was towed over Etihad Stadium.

title: Steve Bing: Elizabeth Hurley remembers the good times with 'sweet, kind' ex
description: Actress Elizabeth Hurley remembers the good times with Steve Bing after his death at the age of 55.

title: Coronavirus: Germany outbreak sparks fresh local lockdown
description: Authorities re-impose lockdown in a German district after an outbreak linked to a meatpacking plant.

title: Intu warns shopping centres may close as funding talks continue
description: Intu, owner of the Trafford, Braehead and Lakeside shopping centres, puts administrators on standby.

title: Burnley 'ashamed' and 'embarrassed' by banner flown over Man City stadium
description: Burnley are "ashamed and embarrassed" by a banner reading 'White Lives Matter Burnley' that was towed by an aircraft over Etihad Stadium during Monday's match against Manchester City.

title: PC Harper murder trial: Officer died in 'shocking circumstances'
description: A jury hears PC Andrew Harper died after being dragged for a mile by a car on a country road.

title: Burnley captain Ben Mee 'ashamed' by banner flown over Man City stadium
description: Burnley captain Ben Mee says he is "embarrassed" by a banner reading "White Lives Matter Burnley" that was flown over their match at Manchester City.

title: 30 Rock: Tina Fey apologises as blackface episodes are withdrawn
description: Tina Fey and co-creator Robert Carlock have asked for four episodes to be removed.

title: Coronavirus: Warning thousands could be left with lung damage
description: Tens of thousands of people will need to be checked to see if they have permanent damage, doctors say.

title: Warnock replaces Woodgate as Middlesbrough boss
description: Championship strugglers Middlesbrough sack boss Jonathan Woodgate, appointing Neil Warnock as his replacement.

title: Andy Murray column: Cycling through lockdown
description: In his latest BBC Sport column, Andy Murray reveals how cycling got him through lockdown and helped build up his fitness for this week's on-court return.

title: Reading stabbings: What we know so far
description: Key developments after an attack, which is being treated as a terrorist incident, left three dead.

title: US soldier accused of planning attack on own unit
description: Ethan Melzer stands accused of sending information about his US Army unit to a neo-Nazi group.

title: Warwick National Grid engineer named among 50 top women
description: Sena Mathobela Nleya says she wants to encourage more girls to become engineers.

title: Shaadi.com: Dating site removes skin tone filter after backlash
description: The site said the filter was "not serving any purpose".

title: Euros On This Day - 23 June: Poborsky's iconic lob, Xabi Alonso's landmark double and Czechs avenge Euro 96 defeat
description: BBC Sport rounds up the best archive action from 23 June in European Championship history.

title: The Papers: Return of culture and tributes to Reading victims
description: Plans to reopen cinemas, museums, art galleries and pubs in England dominate Tuesday's front pages.

title: Coronavirus: Why have there been so many outbreaks in meat processing plants?
description: Why have hundreds of workers tested positive for coronavirus at abattoirs and meat processing plants?

title: 'It was precarious and still is': Bookshops fight back against virus and Amazon
description: Independent bookshops have had to get creative to survive lockdown and compete with Amazon.

title: 'Mum died and we were left to fend for ourselves'
description: Three women share what it is like to witness a parent die - and then lose the other when a step-parent arrives on the scene.

title: Raised in the UK - barred from university
description: Many immigrant teens grow up feeling "British", only to find that they aren't - and cannot legally work or study.
